Indicator: Rainfall variability: Coefficient of variability for CMI (StdDev(CMI)/Mean(CMI); unitless
Climate variability:Risk index based on topographical variability, water resources, water access, water utilisation, human and institutional capacity
Interannual, or between year, variability is defined as the coefficient of variation (CV) of available water for each sub-basin.

Seasonal variability measures the average within-year
variability of available water supply, including both
renewable surface and groundwater supplies.

Drought Index is calculated usingPCR-GLOBWB. The values with
higher DI lead to decrease water security. (Source: Wada 2012)
Direct economic loss in relation to global GDP, damage to critical infrastructure and number of disruptions to basic services, attributed to disasters
Flood mortality risk :Risk calculated as function of hazards (GIS data), vulnerability (statistical analysis of historical events), and modelled population exposure;
Number of deaths, missing persons and directly affected persons attributed to disasters per 100,000 population

Riverine flood risk measures the percentage of population expected to be affected by riverine flooding in an average year, accounting for existing flood-protection standards (frequencies above 10% are considered)
Coastal flood risk measures the percentage of the population expected to be affected by coastal flooding in an average year, accounting for existing flood protection standards.
Flood frequencyindex Source:Center forHetal 2005
total withdrawals /TARWR
TARWR/population (FAO AQUASTAT)
Dam storage capacity / population*100,000
TARWR/HDI (FAO AQUASTAT)
Groundwater table decline measures the average decline of the groundwater table as the average change for the period of study (1990–2014)
Level of water stress: freshwater withdrawal as a proportion of available freshwater resources
River water health index, water resource development: relative water consumption compared to supply
River water health index, water resource development: agriculture sector water stress

Aggregate upstream water demand/total water supply

requirement (EWR). That is, [RWR - (environmental water requirement + withdrawn water)]/RWR

The Peak RepRisk country ESG risk index quantifies
business conduct risk exposure related to environmental,
social, and governance (ESG) issues in the corresponding
country.

Productivity (financial value of industrial goods relative to industrial water withdrawal)

Coastal eutrophication potential (CEP) measures the
potential for riverine loadings of nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), and silica (Si) to stimulate harmful algal blooms
in coastal waters.
Water quality index Srebotnjak etal 2012)
resilience (percentage of renewable water resources stored in large dams)

Risk Management measures the extent
to which countries are buffered from the effects of rainfall variability through large dam storage
Independence measures the extent to which countries water and food supplies are safe and secure from external changes or shocks
Independence from imported water and goods
Proportion of population using (a) safely managed sanitation services and (b) a hand-washing facility with soap and water

exposure (e.g., population density, growth rate)
